reviewText: Boz Scaggs has always been one of those rare breed of artists, who shunned the limelight, even during the peak of his popularity.  Always one to be low key, and an artist who would rather play in a small blues club on the local street corner, Boz Scaggs after his massive success with "Silk Degrees", maintained a low profile, and to this day seems to be in semi-retirement.  This his first live dvd is an absolute grand slam.  The sound and picture quality is phenominal, and the performance makes us all remember, that the Boz man has always been one of rocks most under appreciated artists.  Most of the hits are here, like "Lowdown", "Georgia", "Lido", We're All Alone", "Look What You've Done T0o Me" and "Slow Dancer".  However, we get treated to some blue eyed soul blues with "Ask Me 'Bout Nothin' But The Blues" and of course his classic Steve Miller era tune "Loan Me A Dime", which is simply astounding.  Boz Scaggs won't fill up arena's anymore, but this dvd proves, that classic rockers who now play the club and small theater circuit, still have what it takes to make great music.  Don't miss this dvd or the next Boz tour.
summary: The Boz Man struts his soul!

His backup band is incredible...the horn section on "JoJo" is remarkable... sounding much like the old Tower of Power horn section did, back in the 1970's.You cannot go wrong buying this DVD! reviewText: I was not expecting too much from this concert, but I immediately became impressed with every aspect of the show. The talented musicians and backup singers blend with Scaggs' distinctive voice to provide an enjoyable experience. It features just the right balance of up-tempo songs like Lido Shuffle and ballads such as We're All Alone. For a small ensemble, they display virtuosity on horns, keyboards and guitar. This is the type show that can be watched repeatedly.

reviewText: Just as the "Editorial Review" mentions, "some of the best DVD sound you'll ever hear, and crisp, clear visuals" & "who's still in his prime".Although most music fans remember Boz Scaggs for "Silk Degrees" which is one of the finer albums to come out of that era, many of the songs he sings here will be very familiar Top 40 hits. He sings "Breakdown Dead Ahead" and "Look What You've Done To Me" with the same passion when they were just released. The backup artists are outstanding. My personal favorite is the beautiful "Heart Of Mine" written by Bobby Caldwell which was a minor hit for Boz in 1988.Out of the many great music DVD's I have purchased (from Pink Floyd, "Concert For George", Brian Wilson, to Radiohead) this may be the BEST I have in my collection.

reviewText: I bought this DVD based on the extremely positive reviews on Amazon and the fact I knew a few Boz Scaggs songs from the 1970's.I can safely say that the DVD is now one of the best in my collection. The performances by Boz Scaggs and the other musicians are outstanding and so is the whole production - the theatre is beautiful, the audio and video are superb - overall it is hard to imagine a more professional production of a live concert recording.Also, some artists struggle a bit with their voice as the years roll on, but not Boz Scaggs - I am sure he has got better with age !

reviewText: I've followed Boz Scaggs since his early days with the Steve Miller Band  through his solo career starting with his first solo release on Atlantic featuring Duane Allman and the Muscle Shoales studio musicians as well as all the releases on Columbia and Virgin.This dvd is a career retrospective, so to speak, and from the opening notes and the tight interplay between his drummer and bass player respectively on "Lowdown", one can tell that this is only the beginning of a stellar set.Boz still has the finest voice, in my opinion, in all of blue-eyed souldom and while he's changed the feel and interpretation of some songs ( and in the case of "We're All Alone" lowered the key an octave) they're still as fresh as the first time they were recorded."Slow Dancer", "Harbor Lights", "Look What You've Done To Me" and "We're All Alone" showcase Boz's ability to croon and swoon with the best of them. However for my money the two most outstanding tracks are "Ask Me 'Bout Nothin' But The Blues" and the legendary "Loan Me A Dime" featuring a fantastic guitar interplay between Boz and Drew Zingg. The remaining musicians, Jim Cox and Michael Bluestein on keyboards, Matt Bissonette-bass, John Ferraro-drums, Rich Armstrong-trumpet and percussion, Charles McNeal-saxophones and flute and Ms. Mone't and Barbara Wilson-backing vocals turn in first rate performances throughout.Topping everything off is the fact that the show is shot in high definition video and audio with the mix in stereo as well as 5.1 surround showcasing Boz in the absolute best possible light. I would wholeheartedly urge any fan to rush out and buy this dvd as well as the 2-cd audio set NOW !!!!!
summary: Boz Scaggs at his most sublime.

Boz IS as good as it gets.

reviewText: Boz Scaggs would likely be pleased if he read all the glowing reviews of Boz Scaggs-Greatest Hits Live. Unamimity in praise is not something one usually sees when reading reviews of something so frequently reviewed as this DVD. I feel compelled to point out that of all the books/CDs/DVDs I've reviewed to this date that have generated many other reviews, that this is the first time that reviews have been not only all positive for whatever reason, but all five star plus! Mr Scaggs, take a bow!I own most of Boz Scaggs work in one form or another but I never gave a DVD a thought until I stumbled upon samples of this work featured on the CD/DVD set Fade Into Light. I liked what I saw and heard there and so ordered this without hesitation.I won't go over the technical aspects or the names of all the musicians, other reviewers have already done that. What I will say is that on first viewing I was floored! Greatest Hits Live is simply spectacular.Unlike some of the reviewers who kind of leave the impression that they think Scaggs' career began with Top 40 radio hits (i.e. Lowdown), I think that his best work both preceded and followed his radio-friendly or "disco" period. Most of the songs here are from that period, but most of the best of the DVD is from the periods I mentioned. Not many remember that Scaggs got AM radio play on a couple of songs from Moments and a couple of others before Lowdown lifted him from a cult figure to an international star.If you are one of those who dislike Scaggs' period of mass popularity, put those feelings aside and give this DVD a chance. Scaggs proves himself not only to be one of the coolest, most urbane and sophisticated balladeers in the business, but also a master of blue-eyed soul and a wicked guitarist in the bargain.  And his entire band is first-rate.My favorites here include: a dazzling rendition of Lowdown that opens the concert and sets a high standard for musicianship here; the late period horn-driven blues of It All Went Down The Drain; the haunting romance of Harbor Lights; the plaintive Ask Me 'Bout Nothin' But the Blues; the rousing Georgia; and We're All Alone, the stellar romantic ballad that closes the show. But the best is saved for last and should blow you away the way it did the audience.Lido Shuffle seemed to energize an already rapturous crowd and set the stage for the two best songs of the set in which Scaggs and his band cut loose and showed what they are really capable of. I own a lot of excellent concert DVDs, but I can't think of a point on any of them where I am glued to the screen in awe at the musicianship as I am when I am watching and listening to Runnin' Blues and Loan Me A Dime. The keyboard wizardry on both songs is a wonder to behold and the guitar on Loan Me A Dime has you forgetting all about Duane Allman for the moment. Those two songs alone are worth the price of the DVD.Don't miss the extras either. I really enjoy the second, jazzier version of Harbor Lights as much as the one in the concert.Obviously, this review is a strong recommendation. So get your own copy as soon as possible. If you are even a lukewarm Boz Scaggs fan, this DVD will make you listen to and appreciate him in a new way. It sure did the trick for me!

reviewText: I have been listening avidly to Boz since the early seventies after he split from Steve Miller's band though I am not even expert enough to tell you if he played bass or guitar or what for Steve. I remember a really funny picture of him on the back of Steve's "Sailor" album I remember he wrote Steve's songs Overdrive, Dime-A-Dance Romance and co-wrote some others (My Friend, Going to Mexico). Since going solo he did some incredible albums which even more incredibly are not currently available on CD (how is this possible???) such as Boz & Band, My Time and Moments. His vocals on these are so hauntingly beautiful. He really hit with Silk Degrees, I guess. Anyway, I was amazed that his performance on this DVD was so good as to be possibly the best BOZ I have ever heard and that is saying something monumental. I was so impressed by his singing voice and delivery - it is not that he has not aged - he has aged like wine or scotch - his "aged" improvement is all richness and quality and depth and it amazes me. I am resolved to see him live even if I have to go to his bar in LA or whatever. The funny thing about this DVD is that my favorite song is one I had never heard before - "Heart of Mine". Whoever wrote that song knew Boz's strengths and soul and crafted a song perfect for the man. It's easy to know if you will like this DVD. Listen (and watch) the first cut - Lowdown. If you aren't immedialtely hooked, you never will be. Thanks to Boz for this DVD - I really did not think Harbor Lights could be performed more hauntingly than it is on the CD and I was wrong. I'm buying copies for my closest friends for Christmas this year. Thanks to everyone involved in this project - PLEASE do it again soon.
summary: Quite possibly the BEST of Boz

reviewText: This is a great performance by a great musician, I really think his singing has gotten better over the years. I originally purchased the CD and have listened to it for over 3 years with great satisfaction, when I saw it on DVD, I had to have it. The DVD is better than the CD in so many ways, some of the songs that I really didn't listen to on the CD are some of my favorites on the DVD. This is one I hope they transfer to Blu-ray. The audio is excellent and the video and video production is superb too. I've watched this a number of times and every time I hear "I Just Go" , "Can You Loan Me A Dime" and "Heart of Mine" I can justify the money spent on this excellent performance. Very highly recommended to Boz fans and Blues fans.I wish Amazon had a 3 criteria rating that would make for a quicker, more accurate and fair rating of Cd's, DVD's and Blu-ray's.1. Performance2. Quality of Audio3. Quality of Video (for DVD's and Blu-ray's)1.*****2.*****3.*****Artists that wish to have there performances recorded and recognized should be held to a standard. Poor audio, no matter how good the performance, is still a bad product. Those who would still purchase sub-standard Audio or Video quality recordings and rank that product highly just because of performance are not doing the industry or the band justice. Demand better and we will get it, settle for less and that's what you'll get.

reviewText: The Great American Music Hall is the perfect setting for this intimate concert.  Boz Scaggs and his band are in top form, starting the show off with his classic song "Lowdown."  Boz's voice and guitar playing are perfect for the blues, especially on "It All Went Down The Drain" and "Ask Me 'Bout Nothin' But The Blues."  Boz really shines on the ballads "Harbor Lights" and "Miss Sun."  He also gets the audience up on its feet and dancing with his rocking versions of "Breakdown Dead Ahead" and "Lido Shuffle."  After the encore, Boz and his band really let loose with extended jams on "Runnin' Blue" and "Loan Me A Dime."  For content, as well as visual and sound quality, this is one of the best concert DVDs of all time!
Title: N/A

reviewText: All the five-star reviews here are spot on: this is one of the finest concert DVDs I've seen. Period. What an incredibly gifted group of musicians, and what a great performance by the man himself - his voice sounds better than on any CD I have.The video is crystal clear (in near hi-def, 16:9 aspect ratio format), and the thoughtful editing complements the beautiful, intimate setting - no smoke and mirrors, and thankfully no MTV-style rapid-fire changing of camera angles, either. The DVD has Dolby 2, Dolby 5.1 and DTS 5.1 soundtracks, and both the Dolby and DTS surround tracks are fabulous - this really is one of the top three concerts I own in terms of sound quality.The song selection, likewise, offers a great mix of up-tempo hits with a few excellent blues numbers to vary the pace a little.  Loan me a dime alone is worth the price of the DVD by itself. A classy event from start to finish, recommended without the slightest reservation.

reviewText: I have the Boz Scaggs Greatest Hits Live DVD for at least five years, and it is still better than 99% of any other concert DVD out there, including Blu Ray's. Just took a look again, and I really noticed the lighting. The best of any concert DVD. I was a portrait photographer for years, and I must say the lighting angles, etc, are the best. Of course, the DTS sound is magnificent with every instrument and voice in the great mix. And, what can you say about the band, and Boz himself. I don't know how it could get any better than this. If you are any bit of a Boz fan, this is the concert DVD for you. The only other that comes close is the Toto, Falling in Between on BluRay. Still get goosebumps watching and listening to Boz.
Title: N/A

reviewText: GREATEST HITS LIVE is a "Must Have" DVD for your collection. This disk includes something for everyone, with Boz including songs from many points along the way during his long and incredible career. Of course, Greatest Hits includes songs from his Silk Degrees heyday, like "Lowdown", "Georgia" and "Lido Shuffle"; but also songs that will appeal to the Boz afficionado, as well; like "Slow Dancer", "Runnin' Blue", "I Just Go", and "Ask Me 'Bout Nothin' But The Blues."The production values on this DVD are unparalleled. This special night with Boz was captured in High Definition, and with incredibly high quality DTS 5.1 Multi-Channel audio. You will literally feel that you were there in San Francisco, seated at the Great American Music Hall for this auspicious event.Do yourself a favor, add this DVD to your collection, now. You will not be disappointed. You will find yourself experiencing this concert again and again. The performance opens with strength and gets better and better as it goes. The beautiful backup singers will amaze you on "Look What You've Done To Me", "Miss Sun" and "Harbor Lights". And of course, Boz and his ensemble rip up encore favorites like "Runnin' Blue" (where the players improvise in turn) and "Loan Me A Dime".Who knows? The finale, with the ethereal ballad "We're All Alone" may just have you dancing the night away in your living room or Home Theater, as it did us. This is a timeless DVD that will never grow old.

reviewText: I will be the odd one in this long serie of extremely positive reviews, where everyone gives five out of five.First, why I am not totally satisfied with this collection.- Having most of what Boz Scaggs has released, there are some things I like more than others. Obviously, on a CD-DVD titled "Greatest Hits", you are expected to hear just that, his greatest hits. You do hear and see several of his greatest songs, but why is the albumSome Changecompletely ignored ? Again, a selection is just that, taking in some and letting others out but I would have kept at least "sierra" instead of "I just go", or "lend me a dime", or even the ultra heard "we're all alone", also performed by Rita Coolidge if I remember well. "Heart of mine" is generally a crowd favourite, but to me Bobby Caldwell performs it much better than Boz, so that's one I systematically skip. Too much softness kills me.- The musicians are great for this type of gig, although I knew none of them before seeing this dvd. But, like it or not, you can't replace Lukather on guitars or Jeff Porcaro on drums, especially on "Lowdown", "Jojo", or "Breakdown dead ahead". Yes, I am a romantic. And a dreamer. But those two positions should have been better filled...Of the two, the drummer is the weakest link. The overall impression is that of a middle of the road musician, well in line, not too spectacular or flashy. Too discrete in my opinion.- The stage. Much too small. With everyone performing, you have ten people on approximately 12 by 20 feet. How they managed not to run into each other or kick anybody of the set is a miracle... The drummer is locked in behind a plexiglass, the two key-piano players are sharing their sweat dripping from their back, the guitar player hardly has any space to move his hips.Now to the goodies !- The guy ! Boz is a class act. Educated, respectful, considerate. Thin (almost slim) when so many singers put on those extra kilos at that age, he is also in great vocal shape. Sure, he doesn't have that enigmatic women idol look he had in the late seventies, but he is like top of the line wine. Bonified with time.- The sound quality. Top of the line. Little to no junk sounds, no static, no weaknesses. All the instruments sound great when they need to. Chapeau to the sound engineers !- The picture quality. Like other reviewers said, no MTV nonsense with stupid shots. We see the crowd when we need to, but just enough. We see the musicians when we need to. And the colours are splendid. I saw this one on a Pioneer plasma 52 inches. Ooooh lala.....Don't think we need a blu ray version. Also, remember this thing is from 2004.- The general atmosphere, with a no nonsense attitude. You have no body guards between the stage and the musicians, and if there is any type of security, it's not visible. No hurdles or barriers between the stage and the public. The first row of seats is just 2 meters (six feet) away from Boz. Now that is intimate...- Lowdown, Miss Sun, Lido Shuffle, Georgia, Breakdown dead ahead, Jojo. Sierra (see above), Simone, Some Change and maybe Hard times are missing though.- The stage... well, yes. Too small, but at the same time more human than most of the stages I have seen. I saw Boz in concert in Madrid several years ago, and even got to talk a little to him after the concert (also excellent by the way). I asked him if he would ever get together with the musicians from TOTO for another album. He was very clear : NO. I think he just prefers the cozy, intimate settings. His latest discography confirms that. And so does this concert.In short, you will see and hear the Boz of this century, even when playing songs from the seventies and eighties. This means a bluesier touch to the songs (at times it even comes to be borderline with country, as a friend of mine pointed out). Here, you have almost two hours of concert.As always, enjoy the music, and the filming in this case !

reviewText: I have enjoyed Boz's music for years especially from his 70's/80's rule at the top, winning Grammies, enjoying the limelight etc. I never had the opportunity to catch him live so when this baby became available, I just had to have it.Pure curiosity it was at the time. How was I to know that this DVD would eclipse many classic DVDs that I had in my collection.So polished are the performances, flawless vocals from Boz and the backing vocals from the two talented young ladies, Ms. Mone't and Barbara Wilson are superb.The Band...Jim Cox..KeyboardsMichael Bluestein..KeyboardsDrew Zingg..GuitarMatt Bissonette..BassJohn Ferraro..DrumsRich Armstrong..TrumpetCharles McNeal..SaxophoneBoz has a unique voice, smooth as honey at times and grittier than sandpaper at other times. Whether he is crooning out a ballad or an upbeat number, Boz is always in complete control. I found the blues based tracks really showcase his range and control.Boz and his band really are a class act and the DVD is pure perfection. He has surrounded himself with the best of musicians. Boz's talent has flourished over the years and he has delivered one of the best performances that you will ever see in this concert DVD.

reviewText: Boz Scaggs was the first concert I ever saw, in 1977, as a freshman in high school.  I have most of his CD's, but hadn't listened to them much in recent years.  When I got hooked on concert DVD's and put together a killer new widescreen and sound system, I bought this DVD for my collection.  Out of the 40 or so I have, this is in my top five.  The video quality is superb.  I DVR'd it in hi-def and 5.1 off of HDNet and the viseo was only slightly better than the DVD if using progressive scan and the sound wasn't as good as the DVD (in DTS).  The sound quality is top notch, offering a DTS track (better than Dolby as uses less compression).  There are a lot of blues songs on here that is a mixed bag for me but nearly all of his hits are here.  Stays pretty close to the original versions except for Lido.  You would never know these songs are 25-30 years old from the freshness of his voice.  Even if you just sorta like Boz, I highly recommend you get this.
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're a fan of Boz Scaggs you'll think you'd died and gone to Heaven watching this DVD. Boz is one of the great ones, and I'm very pleased to have found him on video. If you are not a fan of Boz now, you will be after the first song.  The DVD is extremely high quality, which makes experiencing the audio and video almost better than...well, you get the idea.  The band is right on time from start to finish.  And Boz doesn't hold anything back during this performance.  Specifically, Boz' collaboration with Mone't (one of the backup singers) on the song Miss Sun is positively spellbinding.  It makes the hair on the back of my neck stand on end--I can't stop watching it!The DVD features the ability to watch the entire performance altogether as well as song-by-song.  It also takes you backstage both before and after the performance, and there is a photo gallery feature too.This is the quality of entertainment upon which you cannot place a dollar value.  Boz Scaggs' Greatest Hits - Live on DVD pays for itself with every viewing.  You cannot be disappointed!
Title: N/A
